title: Asparagus & Garlic Pitta with Eggs
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss asparagus and garlic with half the almonds, salt, pepper and lemon & herb; spread on a tray.
Season eggs and place on the tray. Roast for 50 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Mexican Tofu (firm) with Baby potatoes & Garlic
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C.
Toss garlic and courgette with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and garam masala; spread on a tray.
Season tofu (firm) and place on the tray. Roast for 41 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Black beans and Broccoli Pan-Fry
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook black beans 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and garlic with italian herbs 2 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Green beans & Asparagus Quinoa with Tuna (canned)
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat peanut butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook tuna (canned) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry green beans and asparagus with harissa 33 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the quinoa according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Tuna for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Quinoa or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Swiss Black beans with Whole-wheat pasta & Peas
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix black beans with italian herbs and a pinch of salt.
Layer with peas, onion and whole-wheat pasta.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.

title: Cabbage & Cherry tomatoes Pitta with Prawns
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
Toss cabbage and cherry tomatoes with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and cajun blend; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Roast for 44 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix chickpeas with smoked paprika + cumin and a pinch of salt.
Layer with kale, asparagus and sweet potato.
Cook sweet potato until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.

Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
